PARAGRAPH.STRING: , officially the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands (CNMI), is a commonwealth in political union with the United States of America at a strategic location in the western Pacific Ocean.
consists of 15 islands about three-quarters of the way from Hawaii to the Philippines, at 15°1'2N,145°4'5E.
has a population (2005 est) of 80,362. The official 2000 census count was 69,221 . The total land area of all islands is 463.63 km (179.01 sq mi), as reported by the United States Census Bureau.
